welcome.title: Welcome to Sublarr
welcome.subtitle: Let's set up your subtitle manager in a few quick steps.

mode_step.description: Choose how you want to use Sublarr.
mode_step.arr_description: Use with Sonarr and/or Radarr for automatic media detection
mode_step.standalone_description: Point at media folders directly, no Sonarr/Radarr needed

arr_step.description: Connect your *arr instances to detect missing subtitles.

standalone_step.description: Point Sublarr at your media folders directly.
standalone_step.media_folders_help: Add folders containing your media files. Sublarr will scan them for series and movies.

pathmapping_step.description: Map remote paths to local paths (if *arr runs on a different host).
pathmapping_step.label: Path Mapping
pathmapping_step.help: Format: remote_prefix=local_prefix (semicolon-separated for multiple). Leave empty if Sublarr runs on the same host as Sonarr/Radarr.

providers_step.description: Configure subtitle provider API keys for searching.
providers_step.info: AnimeTosho works without an API key. Add others for broader coverage.

ollama_step.description: Set up the LLM translation backend.

mediaservers_step.description: Configure media servers for automatic library refresh after subtitle downloads.
mediaservers_step.info: Add media servers for automatic library refresh after subtitle downloads. You can skip this and configure later in Settings.

scan_step.description: Run your first wanted scan to find missing subtitles.
scan_step.info: Run a scan to find episodes and movies missing subtitles.
scan_step.scan_started: Scan started! Check the Wanted page for results.
